intro: Craniospermum pseudotuvinicum, commonly known as the Tuvinian skullcap, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high elevations, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant traits. Craniospermum pseudotuvinicum is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
